comments.body: i originally was opposed to the design and functionality of bees but they’ve grown on me. I’d say maybe just simply make multiple appear and attack instead of one.
Or we can just make them the size of baby turtles and remove baby bees since the babies in real life are actually eggs first, and then larvae, and they are already adultss.
Spiders.
I guess that´s a leftover from pigs. And they are really quiet whille walking, they don´t sound like pigs walking.
What teo pazdrijan said. Its hard to think that they left that over, one of Minecraft's icons. Explosive Bacon that has toes.

Yes, but it would look quite odd
Feel roughly the same way about stripped logs, but it kinda makes sense since it's a log. *shrug*
How would you wanna dye a diamond armor? The idea of the armors' look is also making them unique: A full light-blue armor equipped person, you can instantly see, it is diamond.
It's a good idea and would help the game economy.

This is a great idea, but one that should have a toggle, since not everyone would like to leave a sign saying, “Look at where I logged off the world!” Lol. Especially on worlds and servers with people who like to use tactical combat logouts
Except they can't blink.
I don't think its impossible to make them blink

There should be a skin-making option to make your player slightly animated (e.g. allow him/her to blink or hair waving).

Besides, he could be talking about in MC Bedrock, where skins that come with the game actually do blink.
They do blink if thye are made on character creator good idea.
The same thing should apply to string and redstone dust in my opinion, both currently make stone sounds.
I think it should be a wooly sort of sound (wool breaking noise). I think that would fit well
Everyone I talked to about transparent mobs thinks it's ugly. In addition to this, it causes lag issues for me. Why is it so hard to add a simple toggle to make your playerbase happy, mojang?

At bare minimum, I would love a toggle because I can’t tell what’s going on with any transparency cases. For example, when villager trading, I like to belly up to them, but it doesn’t make sense that I can see through them when interacting with them.

This can be disabled in Settings > Accessibility. The options are called "Enable Dithering for Blocks" and "Enable Dithering for Mobs".

I only just found this now, I was looking in settings visuals for a toggle instead of accessibility. Hope this helps the 20 something people who also cant find the toggle :]
I would love this change because players and other mobs disappear too close to the player currently.
please !

it would be great!.
but Minecraft Java Edition has a very complex code and I doubt that Mojang will decide to remake the code from scratch, since as we all know Mojang does not CHAMBEA, although it would be very good if they optimized it for at least a PC with at least 4GB of ram.
although we can upvote this comment so that Mojang sees it.

i think its on the app that can use too much of RAM, can't play properly,easily can die in Game...

Great idea, but it would be hard to put a new player position in the controls. If this is somehow possible to easily put in, objects like chairs should be added and be able to be sat on, as a complementary feature.
I mean we can already do this animation in mods, I don’t think it be that hard for controllers
It can't be that difficult. This modification is also possible on servers. I would love to do that in single player without having to use a minecart.
In the new wild update they might have teased this in some of their sketches for upcoming biome updates.
simple, an emoji that keep looping till the player move

I also think of standard shaders as a new graphics engine but something that is lightweight and optimized for all devices including bedrock
A calculation-optimized shaders would bring the game an improved and more exciting experience in times when graphics are dominating games
My idea is a realistic lighting that does not leave the proposal of the game but that improves its ambient lighting and brings realistic shadows to the game
Something that doesn’t weigh when it’s time to play and that is a sight for the eyes
Bello
Great Idea
Might cause performance issues but otherwise good.

I have seen this idea before (but not on this website), and I agree. Infinity arrows should definitely be distinct from normal arrows in some way. One idea I have is making the actual arrow invisible, but overlay where the arrow would appear to be with an enchantment glint. This means you would be shooting arrows made of enchantment glint.
Green Lantern anybody?
I never thought about them being magical arrows before. I think this should be added. Good idea.
That would be very cool! Sadly I use crossbows and mending instead of infinity for a few certain reasons. Maybe the arrows should also shatter after hitting something?

I agree. While it may not sound like much, it would be help level the playing field with players who have infinity bows. Sometimes in a fight, you want to wait out a player to let them run out of arrows, but you can't always tell. Learning about your opponents strengths is part of combat.
It would certainly give a more endgame type of feel, I'd really like this
Looks amazing! One suggestion, maybe make the whole texture a little lighter because it looks a bit too similar to netherite
what's wrong with it?
there's no problem with it c'mon

It can sometimes be a bit creepy.
I think there should be a toggle to turn blinking on or off.
Its creepy. Please either add a toggle or remove it
I agree with Whiteowl they could just add a toggle
whats wrong with the blinking???
But why? It’s a fun detail…
a toggle would be cool!!
no
Animations belong in Graphics, moving thread.
If cats also stretched when they woke up that would be great too. Same with dogs.

The funny thing here is that enderman actually did have green eyes at one point but was changed to match the end from my understanding. But there eyes changing after defeating the ender dragon now that's an interesting idea.

I like it! You've got my vote!
I had this same idea! Endermen eyes should change back to the original green when there isn't an ender dragon present.
I think only some of them should get green eyes, and that the ones that do become peaceful.
They should still be their current color when the dragon is alive though
By the colour theory, you could get a nice dual combination of opposite colours from purple and green. Besides that, the item "eye of ender" could be their own.
The ender eyes are definitely not the endermen's eyes, they're just ender pearls that look like eyes.
Hurry up and bring out Minecraft RTX on Console. Otherwise people will have enough and won't play your game. You have new gen consoles let it run smoother on them.

Bruh, Mojang, Because of the more recent updates you are literally losing people, and like this guy said, it clearly ran smoothly, just hand over the rtx, It's not that hard you bunch of morons, significantly more detailed games have it just fine, even my old phone could handle it on a minecraft website supporting shaders, what's the deal?! Either give it to us or explain exactly why you won't.
Animated skins seems a bit of a stretch, but glowing texture would be cool.

I think that'd be pretty cool. I have a homelander (from The Boys) Skin that I really like but I always thought it'd be cool if I could make the eyes glow red. The animation would also help because I could make it look like the eyes are flickering or surging or smth. Or make his cape flow.
i need mojang to do this ima hack them on kali linux if they dont lol but being honest they need to do this
I agree. I have a gaming rig, and even it can't reach 60 fps in vanilla sometimes. Minecraft's basic source code needs serious optimization. We shouldn't have to install mods just to play the game.

This texture seems extremely similar to nether brick, so could work well in nether-themed builds or in roofs in general, alongside your already mentioned uses. I'm pointing out here though that there are multiple ways of implementing this texture into the game as a new block, such as a stone-cut nether brick variant or the plank of one of the upcoming nether trees.

Responding to Willem H:

Cool Idea! my only concern is villagers do not have the technology to visit the nether, so it would not fit in with the vanilla storyline. I agree it could be useful for nether-themed builds though.
I think it's gonna be more like a greenish color, because in the swamp is all wet and mossy
